titleStmt.title: J. B. English et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9006

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his excellency James F. Robinson governor of the Commonwealth of Ky

We the undersigned citizen of Carroll & Owen counties -- would most respectfuflly represent to your excellency that some time during the spring term of the Carroll circuit court that L. E. Krutz (who had resided in Carroll Co but for some time past in Owen) or was fined for selling whiskey in quantity contrary to law -- The scircumstances as we understand and believe are these -- Krutz had obtained licenses for a year -- he through forgetfulness and neglect let his licenses run out a few day it seems he sold some whiskey during the interim we know Mr. Krutz to be a good orderly quiet citizen a poor man with a large family -- in view of the scircumstance attending Mr. Krutz ^case^ fine we would most ^irnestly^ gereatfully request your excellency to remit his fine ^$42^ June 29 1863

J. B. English
J. P. Orr Jr
Jas M Brown sheriff
Philips Edmondson
Jo. C. Kevell
George K. Sanders
Joel Williams
Charley Breede
J. B. Beiden
John T. Ralston

Carroll Cir. Ct
$60 } Tipling
Fine Remitted
J F Robinson
L E Krutz
Issd Aug 28. 186e
